intro: Hippocratea macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant can grow as a shrub or small tree. Hippocratea macrantha is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
